e4: Adopting the new policy aligns ABC with ethical financial standards, enhancing transparency and trust with stakeholders. It reduces legal risk from potential investigations by regulators like the SEC. Initial misunderstandings by some investors can be mitigated with effective communication strategies, and over time, lead to a more accurate valuation by the market.
e5: An ethical reporting policy ensures accuracy, transparency, and honesty in financial disclosures without manipulation. It should provide clear, unbiased information, allowing stakeholders to make informed decisions. The policy must comply with all legal standards and be communicated effectively to both sophisticated and retail investors to prevent misinterpretation and ensure fairness across the board.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to communicate the policy change to investors to prevent misinterpretation and ensure minimal market impact, as well as what measures they will take to monitor and address initial investor reactions and any potential misinformation or confusion.
